<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Hemisphere Media Group,&nbsp;Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;8. Stockholders' Equity (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	from
	Azteca founders to purchase Hemisphere Class&nbsp;A common stock, par value $0.0001 (such warrants, "Warrants" and such stock, "Class&nbsp;A common stock"); (ii)&nbsp;each share of Azteca
	common stock was automatically converted into one share of Class&nbsp;A common stock; (iii)&nbsp;each Amended Azteca Warrant, as defined below, was automatically converted into an equal number of
	Warrants; and (iv)&nbsp;immediately prior to the consummation of the Transaction, Azteca Acquisition Holdings,&nbsp;LLC and certain existing shareholders of Azteca contributed 250,000 shares of
	Azteca common stock to Azteca for cancellation and agreed to subject an additional 250,000 shares of Class&nbsp;A common stock to certain forfeiture provisions (a total of 503,788 shares of
	Class&nbsp;A common stock is subject to forfeiture) if the market price of shares of Hemisphere Class&nbsp;A common stock does not reach certain levels. Following the consummation of the
	Transaction, there were 10,991,100 shares of Class&nbsp;A stock outstanding and 33,000,000 shares of Hemisphere Class&nbsp;B stock outstanding. Subsequent to the Transaction, an additional 250,000
	shares of Class&nbsp;A restricted stock were issued. From time to time the Company has issued Class&nbsp;A common stock to certain members of management and board of directors as equity
	compensation, subject to time and performance vesting conditions, as discussed below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	December 2014, a shareholder of Class&nbsp;B common stock transferred 3.0&nbsp;million shares of Class&nbsp;B common stock to a third party. As a result, the Class&nbsp;B
	common stock was automatically converted to Class&nbsp;A common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of the filing date of this Form&nbsp;10-K, the last sale price of the Company's Class&nbsp;A Common Stock has not equaled or exceeded $15.00 per share (as adjusted for stock
	splits, share dividends, reorganizations, recapitalizations and the like) for any 20 trading days within at least one 30-trading day period within
	36&nbsp;months following April&nbsp;4, 2013. As a result, approximately 379,000 Class&nbsp;A Common shares have been forfeited.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	the event the last sale price of the Class&nbsp;A Common Stock does not equal or exceed $15.00 per share (as adjusted for stock splits, share dividends, reorganizations,
	recapitalizations and the like) for any 20 trading days within at least one 30-trading day period within 60&nbsp;months following April&nbsp;4, 2013, Class&nbsp;A Common shares totaling
	0.1&nbsp;million and Class&nbsp;B Common Shares totaling 1.5&nbsp;million will be forfeited.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Voting
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Class&nbsp;B common stock votes on a 10 to 1 basis with the Class&nbsp;A common stock, which means that each share of
	Class&nbsp;B common stock will have 10 votes and each share of Class&nbsp;A common stock will have 1 vote. The Class&nbsp;B common stock shall be convertible in whole or in part at any time at
	the option of the holder or holders thereof, into an equal number of Class&nbsp;A common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Equity Incentive Plans
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An aggregate of 4.0&nbsp;million shares of our Class&nbsp;A common stock were authorized for issuance under the terms of the
	Hemisphere Media Group,&nbsp;Inc. 2013 Equity Incentive Plan (the "2013 Equity Incentive Plan). At December&nbsp;31, 2015, 0.8&nbsp;million shares remained available for issuance of stock
	options or other stock-based awards under our Equity Incentive Plan (including shares of restricted Class&nbsp;A common stock surrendered to the Company in payment of taxes required to be withheld
	in respect of vested shares of restricted Class&nbsp;A common stock and available for issuance). The expiration date of the 2013 Equity Incentive Plan, on and after which date no awards may be
	granted, is April&nbsp;4, 2023. The Company's board of directors administers the 2013 Equity Incentive Plan, and has the sole
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-27
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=102,EFW="2227691",CP="HEMISPHERE MEDIA GROUP, INC.",DN="1",CHK=323979,FOLIO='F-27',FILE='DISK121:[15ZCW1.15ZCW78901]FU78901A.;15',USER='WWASSER',CD='13-MAR-2016;14:29' -->
<A NAME="A2227691Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FU78901_1_28">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227691Z10-K_HTM_BG78901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Hemisphere Media Group,&nbsp;Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;8. Stockholders' Equity (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
	plenary authority to, among other things: (i)&nbsp;designate participants; (ii)&nbsp;determine the type, size, and terms and conditions of awards to be granted; (iii)&nbsp;determine the
	method by which an award may be settled, exercised, canceled, forfeited, or suspended.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company's time-based restricted stock awards and option awards generally vest in three equal annual installments beginning on the first anniversary of the grant date, subject to the
	grantee's continued employment or service with the Company. The Company's event-based restricted stock awards and option awards generally vest either upon the Company's Class&nbsp;A common stock
	attaining a $15.00 closing price per share, as quoted on the NASDAQ Global Market, on at least 10 trading days, subject to the grantee's continued employment or service with the Company. Other
	event-based restricted stock awards granted to certain members of our Board vest on the day preceding the Company's annual shareholder meeting.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Stock-Based Compensation
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Stock-based compensation expense related to stock options and restricted stock was $5.6&nbsp;million, $5.9&nbsp;million and
	$7.2&nbsp;million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014, and 2013, respectively. At December&nbsp;31, 2015, there was $2.3&nbsp;million of total unrecognized compensation cost
	related to non-vested stock options, which is expected to be recognized over a weighted-average period of 2.1&nbsp;years. At December&nbsp;31, 2015, there was $3.7&nbsp;million of total
	unrecognized compensation cost related to non-vested restricted stock, which is expected to be recognized over a weighted-average period of 0.9&nbsp;years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Stock Options
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	fair value of stock options granted is estimated at the date of grant using the Black-Scholes pricing model for time-based options and the Monte Carlo
	simulation model for event-based options. The expected term of options granted is derived using the simplified method under ASC&nbsp;718-10-S99-1/SEC Topic 14.D for "plain vanilla" options and the
	Monte Carlo simulation for event-based options. Expected volatility is based on the historical volatility of the Company's competitors given its lack of trading history. The risk-free interest rate is
	based on the U.S. Treasury yield for a period consistent with the expected term of the option in effect at the time of the grant. The Company has estimated forfeitures of 1.5%, as the awards are to
	management for which the Company expects lower turnover, and has assumed no dividend yield, as dividends have never been paid to stock or option holders and will not be paid for the foreseeable
	future.
</FONT>
</P>

<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;FONT-SIZE:1.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
	&#8203;
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_GRID,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->
<FONT>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;FONT-SIZE:1.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
	&#8203;
<FONT>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	weighted average grant date fair value of options granted for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013 was $4.13, $3.75 and $4.21. At December&nbsp;31, 2015,
	0.3&nbsp;million options granted are unvested, event-based options.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Restricted Stock
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Certain
	employees and directors have been awarded restricted stock under the 2013 Equity Incentive Plan. The time-based restricted stock grants vest primarily
	over a period of three years. The fair value and expected term of event-based restricted stock grants is estimated at the grant date using the Monte Carlo simulation model.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-29
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, 0.2&nbsp;million shares of restricted stock issued are unvested, event-based shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Warrants
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	connection with the capitalization of the Company noted above, the Company has issued 14.7&nbsp;million warrants, which qualify as equity instruments.
	Each warrant entitles the holder to purchase one-half of the number of shares of our Class&nbsp;A common stock at a price of $6.00 per half share. At December&nbsp;31, 2015, 13.3&nbsp;million
	warrants were issued and outstanding, which are exercisable into 6.7&nbsp;million shares of our Class&nbsp;A common stock. Warrants are only exercisable for a whole number of shares of common
	stock (i.e.&nbsp;only an even number of warrants may be exercised at any given time by a registered holder). As a result, a holder must exercise at least two warrants, at an effective exercise price
	of $12.00 per warrant. At the option of the Company, 8.7&nbsp;million warrants may be called for redemption, provided that the last sale price of our Class&nbsp;A common stock reported has been at
	least $18.00 per share on each of twenty trading days within the thirty-day period ending on the third business day prior to the date on which notice of redemption is given. The warrants expire on
	April&nbsp;4, 2018. In December 2015, we repurchased 1.3&nbsp;million warrants from a single holder in a privately negotiated transaction for a total cost of $1.8&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, we issued 5,000 shares of our Class&nbsp;A common stock upon the exercise of 10,000 warrants for total exercise proceeds of
	$0.1&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;9. Contingencies
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company is involved in various legal actions, generally related to its operations. Management believes, based on advice from legal counsel, that the outcome of such legal actions
	will not adversely affect the financial condition of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-30
</FONT>
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;11. Retirement Plans
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WAPA, a wholly owned subsidiary of the Company, makes contributions to the Televicentro de Puerto Rico Special Retirement Benefits (the "Retirement Plan"). The Retirement Plan is
	available to all reporters and union employees after completing three (3)&nbsp;months of service. Eligible employees, those meeting active service minimums and minimum age requirements, are eligible
	to receive a one-time
	lump sum payment at retirement, of two (2)&nbsp;weeks per year of service capped at a maximum payment of forty-five (45)&nbsp;weeks. The number of retirees is capped at five (5)&nbsp;per year.
	There are 164 participants in the Retirement Plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Following
	is the plan's projected benefit obligation at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	(amounts in thousands
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	):
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_48"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:70%;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLEWIDTH,"100%" -->
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR>
<!-- TABLE COLUMN WIDTHS SET -->
<TD WIDTH="" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>

	December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, the funded status of the plan was as follows (

	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	plan is unfunded. As such, the Company is not required to make annual contributions to the plan.

	thousands):

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amounts
	recorded in accumulated other comprehensive loss are reported net of tax.
</FONT>
</P>

	benefits expected to be paid in each of the next five years and thereafter are as follows (

	amounts in thousands
</I>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WAPA
	makes contributions to the Newspaper Guild International Pension Plan (the "Plan" or "TNGIPP"), a multiemployer pension plan with a plan year end of December&nbsp;31 that provides
	defined benefits to certain employees covered by two CBAs, one of which was scheduled to expire on July&nbsp;23, 2015 and the other of which expires on June&nbsp;27, 2016. Pursuant to its terms,
	the CBA which was scheduled to expire on July&nbsp;23, 2015 automatically renewed for a period of eighteen (18)&nbsp;months upon such expiration date and remains in effect through
	January&nbsp;23, 2017 while the parties negotiate its renewal. WAPA's contribution rates to the Plan are generally determined in accordance with the provisions of the CBAs and a rehabilitation plan
	that was adopted by the TNGIPP.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	risks in participating in such a plan are different from the risks of single-employer plans, in the following respects:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Assets contributed to a multiemployer plan by one employer may be used to provide benefits to employees of other participating
	employer.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	If a participating employer ceases to contribute to a multiemployer plan, the unfunded obligation of the plan may be borne by the
	remaining participating employer.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under
	current law regarding multiemployer defined benefit plans, a plan's termination, WAPA's voluntary withdrawal, or the mass withdrawal of all contributing employers from any
	underfunded multiemployer defined benefit plan would require us to make payments to the plan for our proportionate share of the multiemployer plan's unfunded vested liabilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WAPA
	has received Annual Funding Notices, Report of Summary Plan Information, Critical Status Notices ("Notices") and the above-noted Rehabilitation Plan, as defined by the Pension
	Protection Act of 2006 ("PPA"), from the Plan. The Notices indicate that the Plan actuary has certified that the Plan is in critical status, the "Red Zone", as defined by the PPA, and that a plan of
	rehabilitation ("Rehabilitation Plan") was adopted by the Trustees of the Plan ("Trustees") on May&nbsp;1, 2010 and then updated on November&nbsp;17, 2015. On May&nbsp;29, 2010, the Trustees
	sent WAPA a Notice of Reduction and Adjustment of Benefits Due to Critical Status explaining all changes adopted under the Rehabilitation Plan, including the reduction or elimination of benefits
	referred to as "adjustable benefits." In connection with the adoption of the Rehabilitation Plan, most of the Plan participating unions and contributing employers (including the Newspaper Guild
	International and WAPA), agreed to one of the "schedules" of changes as set forth under the Rehabilitation Plan. WAPA elected the "Preferred Schedule" and executed a Memorandum of Agreement, effective
	May&nbsp;27, 2010 (the "MOA") and
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-33
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=108,EFW="2227691",CP="HEMISPHERE MEDIA GROUP, INC.",DN="1",CHK=5050,FOLIO='F-33',FILE='DISK121:[15ZCW1.15ZCW78901]FW78901A.;12',USER='NDEWIND',CD='11-MAR-2016;15:59' -->
<A NAME="A2227691Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FW78901_1_34">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227691Z10-K_HTM_BG78901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Hemisphere Media Group,&nbsp;Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;11. Retirement Plans (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	agreed
	to the following contribution rate increases: 3.0% beginning on January&nbsp;1, 2013; an additional 3.0% beginning on January&nbsp;1, 2014; and an additional 3% beginning on
	January&nbsp;1, 2015. In 2015, The Plan's Trustee's reviewed the Rehabilitation Plan and the financial projections under the Plan and determined that is was not prudent to continue benefit accruals
	under the current Plan and that implementation of a updated plan with a new benefit design would be in the best interest of the Plan's participants. As a result, the Plan's Board of Trustee's adopted
	changes to the Rehabilitation Plan effective January&nbsp;1, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under
	the Rehabilitation Plan, as revised in 2015, WAPA will need to agree to one of the updated "schedules" of changes as set forth under the revised Rehabilitation Plan. These schedule
	options include a new preferred schedule that does not require contribution increases but requires the employer to commit to remaining in the Plan for an additional five years, or the existing
	preferred schedule or a default schedule, both of which require annual contribution increases of 3% (starting January&nbsp;1, 2016).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	contribution increases and effect of the Rehabilitation Plan as described above are not anticipated to have a material effect on the Company's results of operations. However, in the
	event other contributing employers are unable to, or fail to, meet their ongoing funding obligations, the financial impact on WAPA to contribute to any plan underfunding may be material. In addition,
	if a United States multiemployer defined benefit plan fails to satisfy certain minimum funding requirements, the Internal Revenue Service may impose a nondeductible excise tax of 5.0% on the amount of
	the accumulated funding deficiency for those employers contributing to the fund.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
	WAPA completely or partially withdrew from the Plan, it would be obligated to pay complete or partial withdrawal liability (which could be material). Pursuant to the last available
	notice (for the Plan year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014), WAPA's contributions to the Plan exceeded 5% of total contributions made to the Plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Further
	information about the Plan is presented in the table below (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	amounts in thousands
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	):
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:54%;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	(a)
</FONT>
</DT>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	sum of the quarters will not equal the full year due to rounding.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(b)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	On
	April&nbsp;1, 2014, the Cable Networks Acquisition was consummated, and the operating results are included in our consolidated financial statements as
	of the date of the acquisition.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(c)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	On
	April&nbsp;4, 2013, the merger by and among Cinelatino, WAPA Holdings and Azteca providing for the combination of Cinelatino, WAPA Holdings and Azteca
	as indirect, wholly-owned subsidiaries of Hemisphere (the "Transaction") was consummated. Although Hemisphere issued the equity interests in the Transaction, since it was a new entity formed solely to
	issue these equity interests to effect the Transaction it was not considered the acquirer and one of the combining entities that existed before the transaction was identified as the acquirer. WAPA was
	identified as the accounting acquirer and predecessor, whose historical results became the results of Hemisphere. The operating results of the acquired businesses are included in our consolidated
	financial statements as of the Transaction date.
</FONT>
</DD>

<EFX_EXHIBIT_10>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_10"></A>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Exhibit 10.16
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	EXECUTION COPY
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	PRIVATE AND CONFIDENTIAL
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:1.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT (the &#147;
<U>
	Agreement
</U>
	&#148;) dated as of August&nbsp;7, 2015, by and between Hemisphere Media Group,&nbsp;Inc., a Delaware corporation (the &#147;
<U>
	Company
</U>
	&#148;), and Vicky Bathija (&#147;
<U>
	Executive
</U>
	&#148;).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:1.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	WHEREAS, the Company desires to employ Executive and Executive is willing to serve the Company for the period and upon such other terms and conditions of this Agreement; and
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:1.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	WHEREAS Executive&#146;s agreement to enter into this Agreement and be bound by the terms hereof, including the restrictive covenants herein, is a material inducement to the Company&#146;s willingness to grant stock options and restricted stock to Executive and the Company would not otherwise grant such stock options and restricted stock to Executive if Executive did not agree to enter into this Agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:1.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual agreements, provisions and covenants contained herein, and intending to be legally bound hereby, the parties hereto agree as set forth below:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:1.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	1.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<U>
	Term
</U>
	.&#160; (a)&nbsp; The term of Executive&#146;s employment under this Agreement shall be effective on August&nbsp;7, 2015 (the &#147;
<U>
	Effective Date
</U>
	&#148;), and shall continue until December&nbsp;31, 2018 (the &#147;
<U>
	Initial Expiration Date
</U>
	&#148;), provided that on the Initial Expiration Date and each subsequent anniversary of the Initial Expiration Date, the term of Executive&#146;s employment under this Agreement shall be extended for one additional year unless either party provides written notice to the other party at least 270 days prior to the Initial Expiration Date (or any such anniversary, as applicable) that Executive&#146;s employment hereunder shall not be so extended (in which case Executive&#146;s employment shall terminate on the Initial Expiration Date or expiration of the extended term, as applicable);
<U>
	provided
</U>
	,
<U>
	however
</U>
	, that Executive&#146;s employment under this Agreement may be terminated at any time pursuant to the provisions of Section&nbsp;4. The period of time from the Effective Date through the termination of this Agreement and Executive&#146;s employment hereunder pursuant to its terms is herein referred to as the &#147;
<U>
	Term
</U>
	&#148;; and the date on which the Term is scheduled to expire (i.e., the Initial Expiration Date or the scheduled expiration of the extended term, if applicable) is herein referred to as the &#147;
<U>
	Expiration Date
</U>
	&#148;.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:1.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(b)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Executive agrees and acknowledges that the Company has no obligation to extend the Term or to continue Executive&#146;s employment following the Expiration Date, and Executive expressly acknowledges that no promises or understandings to the contrary have been made or reached. Executive also agrees and acknowledges that, should Executive and the Company choose to continue Executive&#146;s employment for any period of time following the Expiration Date without extending the term of Executive&#146;s employment under this Agreement or entering into a new written employment agreement, Executive&#146;s employment with the Company shall be &#147;at will&#148;, such that the Company may terminate Executive&#146;s employment at any time, with or without reason and with or without notice, and Executive may resign at any time, with or without reason and with or without notice.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:1.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(c)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	For purposes of this Agreement, the following terms, as used herein, shall have the definitions set forth below.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#147;
<U>
	Affiliate
</U>
	&#148; means, with respect to any specified Person, any other Person that directly or indirectly, through one or more intermediaries, Controls, is Controlled by, or is under common Control with, such specified Person, provided that, in any event, any business in which the Company has any direct or indirect ownership interest shall be treated as an Affiliate of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#147;
<U>
	Change in Control
</U>
	&#148; has the meaning set forth in the Plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:#010101;">

<A NAME="eolPage3"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#147;
<U>
	Control
</U>
	&#148; (including, with correlative meanings, the terms &#147;Controlled by&#148; and &#147;under common Control with&#148;), as used with respect to any Person, means the direct or indirect possession of the power to direct or cause the direction of the management or policies of such Person, whether through the ownership of voting securities, by contract or otherwise.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#147;
<U>
	Governmental Entity
</U>
	&#148; means any national, state, county, local, municipal or other government or any court of competent jurisdiction, administrative agency or commission or other governmental authority or instrumentality.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#147;
<U>
	Person
</U>
	&#148; means any individual, firm, corporation, partnership, limited liability company, trust, joint venture, association, Governmental Entity, unincorporated entity or other entity.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#147;
<U>
	Plan
</U>
	&#148; means the Hemisphere Media Group,&nbsp;Inc. 2013 Equity Incentive Plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:1.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	2.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<U>
	Duties and Responsibilities
</U>
	.&#160; (a)&nbsp; During the Term, Executive agrees to be employed and devote substantially all of Executive&#146;s business time and efforts to the Company and the promotion of its interests and the performance of Executive&#146;s duties and responsibilities hereunder as Executive Vice President, Corporate Development and Investor Relations (&#147;
<U>
	EVP
</U>
	&#148;), upon the terms and conditions of this Agreement. Executive shall perform such lawful duties and responsibilities as directed from time to time by the Chief Executive Officer of the Company or the Chief Financial Officer of the Company (&#147;
<U>
	CFO
</U>
	&#148;) that are customary for a EVP of a corporation of the size and nature of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:1.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(b)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	During the Term, Executive shall report directly to the CFO. Executive acknowledges that Executive&#146;s duties and responsibilities shall require Executive to travel on business to the extent necessary to fully perform Executive&#146;s duties and responsibilities hereunder. It is anticipated that Executive shall physically be on Company premises (or traveling on Company business) during normal business hours (unless absent due to vacation, injury, illness or other approved leave of absence).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:1.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(c)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	During the Term, Executive shall use Executive&#146;s best efforts to faithfully and diligently serve the Company and shall not act in any capacity that is in conflict with Executive&#146;s duties and responsibilities hereunder;
<U>
	provided
</U>
	,
<U>
	however
</U>
	, Executive may manage Executive&#146;s personal investments and affairs and participate in non-profit, educational, charitable and civic activities, to the extent that such activities do not interfere with the performance of Executive&#146;s duties hereunder, and are not in conflict with the business interests of the Company or its Affiliates or otherwise compete with the Company or its Affiliates. Except as provided in the immediately preceding sentence, for the avoidance of doubt, during the Term Executive shall not be permitted to become engaged in or render services for any Person other than the Company and its Affiliates, and shall not be permitted to be a member of the board of directors of any company, in any case without the consent of the Company (for all purposes under this Agreement, any required consent of the Company shall be evidenced by a duly authorized resolution of the Board of Directors of the Company (&#147;
<U>
	Board
</U>
	&#148;)).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:1.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	3.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<U>
	Compensation and Related Matters
</U>
	.&#160; (i)&nbsp;
<U>
	Base Salary
</U>
	.&#160; During the Term, for all services rendered under this Agreement, Executive shall receive an aggregate annual base salary (&#147;
<U>
	Base Salary
</U>
	&#148;) at an initial rate of $350,000 (which shall be increased by 5% on each anniversary of the Effective Date), payable in accordance with the Company&#146;s applicable payroll practices. Base Salary shall be subject to review by the Board annually for increases, but not decreases, deemed necessary or appropriate in its sole discretion. References in this Agreement to &#147;
<U>
	Base Salary
</U>
	&#148; shall be deemed to refer to the most recently effective annual base salary rate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	2
<A NAME="A2227691ZEX-10_16_HTM_23489-2-KW-01_PB_2_010643_7610">
</A>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">

<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=2,EFW="2227691",CP="HEMISPHERE MEDIA GROUP, INC.",DN="2",CHK=235388,FOLIO='2',FILE="DISK122:[15ZCW2.15ZCW78902]23489-2-KW-01_ZCW78902.CHC",USER="BFLANNO",CD='MAR 10 01:11 2016' -->
<A NAME="eolPage4"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:1.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(b)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<U>
	Annual Bonus
</U>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:2.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(i)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	During the Term, subject to Section&nbsp;4(b), for each calendar year, Executive shall have the opportunity to earn an annual bonus (&#147;
<U>
	Annual Bonus
</U>
	&#148;) based on performance against specified objective (including budgetary or EBITDA-based) performance criteria (&#147;
<U>
	Performance Goals
</U>
	&#148;) established by the Board prior to or as soon as practicable following each calendar year (or within 90 days following the Effective Date, in the case of calendar year 2015), which goals shall be substantially consistent with, but to the extent applicable, no less favorable than, the performance goals applicable to the annual bonus for the CFO, subject to Executive&#146;s continued employment through December&nbsp;31 of each such calendar year. Executive&#146;s target annual bonus (&#147;
<U>
	Target Bonus
</U>
	&#148;) shall be $100,000 if the Company achieves at least 100% of its Performance Goals, which bonus shall be pro-rated for calendar year 2015 and the year of termination of employment to reflect in each case the period of Executive&#146;s employment with the Company during such year. Notwithstanding the foregoing, subject to Executive&#146;s continued employment through December&nbsp;31 of each such calendar year, if the Company achieves greater than or equal to 80% of its Performance Goals, the Annual Bonus for calendar year 2015, 2016, 2017 and 2018 shall be not less than $60,000, which bonus shall be pro-rated for calendar year 2015 and the year of termination of employment to reflect in each case the period of Executive&#146;s employment with the Company during such year, with the actual Annual Bonus determined by linear interpolation based on the Company&#146;s achievement of Performance Goals between 80% and 100%. If the Company achieves greater than 100% of its Performance Goals and the CFO therefore receives an annual bonus greater than the target bonus prescribed in the CFO&#146;s employment agreement, the Annual Bonus for Executive shall be increased beyond the Target Bonus level by the same percentage as that by which the CFO&#146;s annual bonus was increased beyond the CFO&#146;s target bonus level.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:2.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(ii)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Any Annual Bonus payable for any calendar year shall be paid in cash as soon as practicable following the determination of the Company&#146;s performance results for such calendar year, but in&#160; no event later than March&nbsp;15th of the calendar year following the calendar year to which such Annual Bonus relates.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:1.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(c)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<U>
	Equity
</U>
	.&#160; As promptly as practicable following the Effective Date, the Company shall grant Executive, pursuant to, and subject to, the terms of the Plan and an option grant certificate substantially in the form attached hereto as
<U>
	Exhibit&nbsp;A
</U>
	, an option (the &#147;
<U>
	Option
</U>
	&#148;) to purchase 100,000 shares of Company common stock (the &#147;
<U>
	Stock
</U>
	&#148;). Each share of Stock subject to the Option shall have an exercise price equal to the fair market value of a share of Stock on the date of grant. As promptly as practicable following the Effective Date, the Company shall grant Executive pursuant to, and subject to, the terms of the Plan and a restricted stock certificate substantially in the form attached hereto as
<U>
	Exhibit&nbsp;B
</U>
	, 25,000 restricted shares of Stock.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:1.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(d)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<U>
	Benefits and Perquisites
</U>
	.&#160; During the Term, Executive shall be entitled to participate in the benefit plans and programs commensurate with Executive&#146;s position, that are provided by the Company from time to time for its senior executives generally, subject to the terms and conditions of such plans.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:1.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(e)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<U>
	Business Expense Reimbursements
</U>
	.&#160; During the Term, the Company shall promptly reimburse Executive for Executive&#146;s reasonable and necessary business expenses incurred in connection with performing Executive&#146;s duties hereunder in accordance with its then-prevailing policies and procedures for expense reimbursement (which shall include appropriate itemization and substantiation of expenses incurred).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	3
<A NAME="A2227691ZEX-10_16_HTM_23489-2-KW-01_PB_3_010713_5335">
</A>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">

</DIV>

<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=3,EFW="2227691",CP="HEMISPHERE MEDIA GROUP, INC.",DN="2",CHK=986232,FOLIO='3',FILE="DISK122:[15ZCW2.15ZCW78902]23489-2-KW-01_ZCW78902.CHC",USER="BFLANNO",CD='MAR 10 01:11 2016' -->
<A NAME="eolPage5"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:1.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(f)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<U>
	Vacation
</U>
	.&#160; During the Term, Executive shall be entitled to four weeks paid vacation each calendar year, in accordance with the Company&#146;s vacation policy to be taken at such times as may be mutually agreed by Executive and the Company. Unused vacation in any calendar year shall be carried over to the next calendar year; provided that, in no event shall Executive&#146;s eligible vacation time exceed 8 weeks in any calendar year.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:1.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(g)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<U>
	Relocation Expenses
</U>
	.&#160; Within thirty (30) days of&#160; Executive&#146;s relocation to the Miami, Florida metropolitan area, or if later, within thirty (30) days of a reimbursable expense being incurred by Executive, the Company shall reimburse Executive for all reasonable costs in connection with such relocation on a fully grossed-up basis, including two (2)&nbsp;to three (3)&nbsp;house hunting trips and broker-related fees incurred in connection with such house-hunting trips, if any, and Executive&#146;s COBRA continuation coverage expenses until such time Executive is eligible to be covered under the Company&#146;s health benefits plan, subject to appropriate itemization and substantiation of expenses incurred.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:1.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(h)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<U>
	Ancillary Fees
</U>
	.&#160; The Company shall reimburse the Executive within thirty (30) days following the Effective Date his reasonable unanticipated fees incurred in connection with his relocation that are not otherwise covered pursuant to Section&nbsp;3(g)&nbsp;or in excess of the amounts allocated therein, up to a maximum of $5,000, subject to appropriate itemization and substantiation of expenses incurred. Additionally, the Company shall be responsible for paying all fees and expenses (including, attorney&#146;s fees) related to the transfer of Executive&#146;s and his family&#146;s H-1B Visa and corresponding applications for green cards with the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services office or other government agencies.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:1.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(i)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<U>
	Indemnification
</U>
	.&#160; The Company agrees that in the event Executive is, or is threatened to be, made a party to any pending, contemplated or threatened action, suit, arbitration or other proceeding, whether civil, criminal, administrative or investigative, and whether formal or informal (each a &#147;
<U>
	Proceeding
</U>
	&#148;), by reason of the fact that Executive is or was, or had agreed to become an officer, employee, agent, representative or fiduciary of the Company, or is or was serving at the request of the Company as a board member, officer, employee, agent or fiduciary of another Person, the Company shall indemnify and hold Executive harmless, to the maximum extent permitted by the Company&#146;s governing documents or, if greater, by applicable law (but not in any event in contravention of the Company&#146;s governing documents), against all expenses, damages, liabilities and losses incurred by Executive,
<U>
	provided
</U>
	that Executive acted in good faith and in a manner that he reasonably believed to be in or not opposed to the best interests of the Company, and, with respect to any criminal Proceeding, had no reasonable cause to believe his conduct was unlawful;
<U>
	provided
</U>
	,
<U>
	further
</U>
	, that Executive shall not be entitled to any such indemnification (A)&nbsp;in respect of any Proceeding based upon or attributable to Executive gaining in fact any personal profit or advantage to which he is not entitled or resulting from Executive&#146;s fraudulent, dishonest or willful misconduct, (B)&nbsp;to the extent Executive has already received indemnification or payment pursuant to the Company&#146;s operating agreement or other governing documents, D&amp;O insurance or otherwise or (C)&nbsp;in respect of any Proceeding initiated by Executive, unless the Company has joined in or the Board has authorized such Proceeding. Expenses incurred by Executive in defending any claim shall be paid by the Company in advance of the final disposition of such claim upon receipt by the Company of an undertaking by or on behalf of Executive to repay such amount if it shall be ultimately determined that Executive is not entitled to be indemnified by the Company pursuant to this Section&nbsp;3(i). To the extent the Company maintains an insurance policy covering the errors and omissions of its Board members and officers, Executive shall be covered by such policy during the Term and for six years following Executive&#146;s termination of employment in a manner no less favorable than Board members and other officers of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	4
<A NAME="A2227691ZEX-10_16_HTM_23489-2-KW-01_PB_4_010728_5796">
</A>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:#010101;">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=4,EFW="2227691",CP="HEMISPHERE MEDIA GROUP, INC.",DN="2",CHK=617604,FOLIO='4',FILE="DISK122:[15ZCW2.15ZCW78902]23489-2-KW-01_ZCW78902.CHC",USER="BFLANNO",CD='MAR 10 01:11 2016' -->
<A NAME="eolPage6"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:1.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	4.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<U>
	Termination of Employment
</U>
	.&#160; (i)&nbsp; Executive&#146;s employment may be terminated by either party at any time and for any reason;
<U>
	provided
</U>
	,
<U>
	however
</U>
	, that Executive shall be required to give the Company at least 60 days advance written notice of any voluntary resignation of Executive&#146;s employment hereunder (and in such event the Company in its sole discretion may elect to accelerate Executive&#146;s date of termination of employment, it being understood that such termination shall still be treated as a voluntary resignation for purposes of this Agreement). Notwithstanding the foregoing, Executive&#146;s employment shall automatically terminate upon Executive&#146;s death.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:1.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(b)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Following any termination of Executive&#146;s employment, notwithstanding any provision to the contrary in this Agreement, the obligations of the Company to pay or provide Executive with compensation and benefits under Section&nbsp;3 shall cease, and the Company shall have no further obligations to provide compensation or benefits to Executive hereunder except (i)&nbsp;for payment of (w)&nbsp;any accrued but unpaid Base Salary through the date of termination, (x)&nbsp;any unpaid Annual Bonus for the year prior to the year in which termination occurs, (y)&nbsp;any accrued but unused vacation days, and (z)&nbsp;any unreimbursed expenses under Section&nbsp;3(e), in each case accrued or incurred through the date of termination of employment, payable as soon as practicable and in all events within 30 days following termination of employment, (ii)&nbsp;as explicitly set forth in any other benefit plans, programs or arrangements applicable to terminated employees in which Executive participates, other than severance plans or policies, and (iii)&nbsp;as otherwise expressly required by applicable law (collectively, the &#147;
<U>
	Accrued Obligations
</U>
	&#148;). For the avoidance of doubt, (A)&nbsp;any Annual Bonus for the year of termination of employment is forfeited if Executive&#146;s employment is terminated for Cause or resignation by Executive other than for Good Reason, and (B)&nbsp;in the case of Executive&#146;s death, any payments to be made to Executive in accordance with this Section&nbsp;4 shall be paid to Executive&#146;s beneficiaries, devisees, heirs, legates or estate, as applicable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:1.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(c)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	(i)
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Except as otherwise provided herein, if Executive&#146;s employment is terminated (I)&nbsp;by the Company without Cause (other than due to death or Disability (as defined below), or due to the Company&#146;s election not to extend the Term beyond the scheduled expiration of the Term on the Expiration Date as contemplated under Section&nbsp;1(a)), or (II)&nbsp;by the Executive for Good Reason, then Executive, in addition to the Accrued Obligations, shall be entitled to receive an aggregate amount equal to (A)&nbsp;the sum of (x)&nbsp;Executive&#146;s Base Salary and (y)&nbsp;the Target Bonus (the &#147;
<U>
	Severance Payment
</U>
	&#148;), plus (B)&nbsp;the product of (x)&nbsp;the actual Annual Bonus that Executive would have been entitled to receive for the year of termination had Executive continued to be employed through the end of the calendar year in which such termination occurs, and (y)&nbsp;a fraction, the numerator of which is the number of calendar days Executive was employed in the calendar year of termination, and the denominator of which is 365 (the &#147;
<U>
	Pro Rata Bonus
</U>
	&#148;). The Severance Payment shall be paid during the 12-month period immediately following such termination in substantially equal installments consistent with the Company&#146;s payroll practices, and the Pro Rata Bonus shall be paid on the date that other executives are paid their annual bonuses in respect of the year in which Executive&#146;s termination occurs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:2.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(ii)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, if at any time within 60 days before, or 12 months following, a Change in Control, Executive&#146;s employment is terminated (I)&nbsp;by the Company without Cause (other than due to death or Disability, or due to the Company&#146;s election not to extend the Term beyond the scheduled expiration of the Term on the Expiration Date as contemplated under Section&nbsp;1(a)), or (II)&nbsp;by the Executive for Good Reason, then Executive, in addition to the Accrued Obligations but in lieu of the payments described in Section&nbsp;4(c)(i), shall be entitled to receive an aggregate amount equal to (A)&nbsp;two times the Severance Payment plus (B)&nbsp;the&#160; product of (x)&nbsp;the Target Bonus for the year of termination, and (y)&nbsp;a fraction, the numerator of which is the number of calendar days Executive was employed in the calendar year
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	5
<A NAME="A2227691ZEX-10_16_HTM_23489-2-KW-01_PB_5_010751_2897">
</A>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:#010101;">
</DIV>

<A NAME="eolPage7"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	of termination, and the denominator of which is 365
</FONT>
	. Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, at any time following a Change in Control, if Executive&#146;s employment is terminated due to the Company&#146;s election not to extend the Term beyond the scheduled expiration of the Term on the Expiration Date as contemplated under Section&nbsp;1(a), then Executive, in addition to the Accrued Obligations, shall be entitled to the Severance Payment. All payments described in this Section&nbsp;4(c)(ii)&nbsp;shall be paid in cash in a lump sum within 30 business days following the execution of the Release that has become irrevocable by its terms; provided, that to the extent any portion of such lump sum payment would violate Section&nbsp;409A (as defined below), then such portion shall be paid during the 12-month period immediately following such termination in substantially equal installments consistent with the Company&#146;s payroll practices.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:2.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(iii)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	If Executive&#146;s employment is terminated due to death or by the Company due to Disability, for Cause (but only pursuant to Section&nbsp;4(c)(v)(D)&nbsp;and not pursuant to Sections 4(c)(v)(A)-(C)), or due to the Company&#146;s election not to extend the Term beyond the scheduled expiration date of the Term on the Expiration Date as contemplated under Section&nbsp;1(a), then Executive, in addition to the Accrued Obligations, shall be entitled to receive payment of the Pro Rata Bonus, payable no later than March&nbsp;15 of the calendar year following the calendar year in which Executive&#146;s termination of employment occurs. In addition to the foregoing, if Executive&#146;s employment is terminated due to the Company&#146;s election not to extend the Term beyond the scheduled expiration of the Term on the Expiration Date as contemplated under Section&nbsp;1(a)&nbsp;prior to a Change in Control, then Executive shall be entitled to continued payment of Executive&#146;s Base Salary during the 6-month period immediately following such termination, in substantially equal installments consistent with the Company&#146;s payroll practices.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:2.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(iv)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Any payments or benefits under Section&nbsp;4(c)(i), 4(c)(ii)&nbsp;or 4(c)(iii)&nbsp;shall be (A)&nbsp;conditioned upon Executive and the Company having executed a mutual, irrevocable waiver and general release of claims substantially in a form attached hereto as
<U>
	Exhibit&nbsp;C
</U>
	(the &#147;
<U>
	Release
</U>
	&#148;) that has become effective in accordance with its terms, (B)&nbsp;subject to Executive&#146;s continued compliance with the terms of this Agreement and (C)&nbsp;subject to Section&nbsp;25.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:2.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(v)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	For purposes of this Agreement, &#147;
<U>
	Cause
</U>
	&#148; means: (A)&nbsp;Executive&#146;s willful refusal to perform his duties for the Company, which refusal or failure remains uncured for 15 days after he receives written notice from the Board demanding cure; (B)&nbsp;in carrying out his duties under the employment agreement, Executive engages in willful&#160; misconduct, or gross neglect, that in either case causes material economic harm to the Company&#146;s business or reputation; (C)&nbsp;Executive is convicted of, or enters a plea of guilty or
<I>
	nolo contendere
</I>
	to, a felony and such conviction or plea has a material adverse effect on his ability to perform his duties for the Company or causes material harm to the Company or its Affiliates; or (D)&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;if Executive&#146;s employment authorization expires (and no renewal application is pending before a government agency in the normal course) or is revoked (and such expiration or revocation is not caused by the Company&#146;s bad faith efforts), or (ii)&nbsp;Executive&#146;s ability to conduct his duties hereunder is otherwise adversely affected by Executive&#146;s immigration or work authorization status.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:2.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(vi)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	For purposes of this Agreement, &#147;
<U>
	Disability
</U>
	&#148; means Executive would be entitled to long-term disability benefits under the Company&#146;s long-term disability plan as in effect from time to time, without regard to any waiting or elimination period under such plan and assuming for the purpose of such determination that Executive is actually participating in such plan at such time. If the Company does not maintain a long-term disability plan, &#147;
<U>
	Disability
</U>
	&#148; means Executive&#146;s inability to perform Executive&#146;s duties and responsibilities hereunder due to physical or mental illness or
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	6
<A NAME="A2227691ZEX-10_16_HTM_23489-2-KW-01_PB_6_010807_3020">
</A>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:#010101;">
</DIV>
